info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 9:33AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Mercer, Rock Island, west central Henry, southern Scott, Muscatine, southeastern Cedar, northwestern Louisa and southeastern Johnson Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 933 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wilton, or 7 miles north of Muscatine, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fairport around 945 AM CDT. Blue Grass and Montpelier around 950 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Walcott, Andalusia, Buffalo, Davenport, Rock Island, Moline, Bettendorf, Riverdale, East Moline, Silvis, Colona, Le Claire, Coal Valley, Hampton, Port Byron and Rapids City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 287 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and southeastern and east central Iowa.
